title: 392. The Prime Minister Who Cried Brexit
description: In 2016, David Cameron held a referendum on whether the U.K. should stay in the European Union. A longtime Euroskeptic, he nevertheless led the Remain campaign. So what did Cameron really want? We ask him that and much more — including why he left office as soon as his side lost and what he’d do differently if given another chance. (Hint: not much.)
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
